name: eqnegad

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(c0, nat0))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cneg(c0)))
-| wi(w0, wb(wceq(c0, cneg(c0)), wceq(c0, nat0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(c0, nat0))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cneg(c0)))
-| wi(w0, wb(wceq(c0, cneg(c0)), wceq(c0, nat0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wceq(c0, cneg(c0)), wceq(c0, nat0)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(c0, nat0))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cneg(c0)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))

comment: If a complex number equals its own negative, it is zero. One-way deduction form of ~ eqneg . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
